title: [Large-scale] Mathematical Simulation Design for Real-world Problem Solving in Digital Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (secondary education level)
context.additional_context: Project-based learning that recreates and solves real-world mathematical problems occurring in practical settings within a VR environment. Learners access simulation tools via personal devices in a setting enabling real-time collaboration with peers and instructors.

learning_goals: Design mathematical models required in real-world work scenarios with over 80% accuracy using simulation tools
Collaboratively solve mathematical problems in VR environments at least three times and incorporate feedback

Learners select one case (inventory optimization or data analysis), apply learned mathematical concepts (linear programming, statistical analysis, etc.) to write a 5-page report, and achieve an "excellent" grade in at least two of three evaluation rubric criteria: applicability to real-world business contexts, calculation accuracy, and clarity of result interpretation
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
